intro: Riedelia curviflora, commonly known as the curling-flower riedelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and other succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
